name: Embassy Suites Hotel Irvine-Orange County Airport

reviews.text: I stayed here the weekend of Feb. 1st while on business at Alliant University. I thought the hotel was just fine (your regular Embassy Suites), but it is going through remodeling right now. I was warned of this on the hotel website. The lobby area and atrium were undergoing re-construction, and the pool and exercise room were closed (this too I was warned about before hand on the hotel's website). It didn't turn out to affect my stay much because I was never in my room during the day. By the time I would get back to my room in the late evening, the workers had gone home and all was quiet. Nonetheless, people should know about this remodeling, and only stay there right now if they are willing to tolerate this inconvenience.
reviews.title: Just Fine, but Going Through Construction

likes.liked: — It was close to where my business meeting was, and it is close to John Wayne Airport

reviews.text: I must have gotten one of the newly remodeled rooms. My room was very large. It had a nice new stainless steel mini fridge and microwave. The bathroom was nice and new with granite counters and new tub. Linens and carpet also looked nice and new.
reviews.title: The Bat Cave
Internet Problems
reviews.text: My husband and daughter accompanied me and went to Disneyland during the day while I was at work. It's about a 10 mile drive on freeways to Disneyland. So, not the closest place to stay if you are going to Disneyland, but it worked for us. I joined my husband and daughter at night to eat at Downtown Disney.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Breakfast was great. I was surprised that there wasn't a big line of people for the made-to-order omelettes. One of the things I haven't liked about staying at Embassy Suites in the past is that even though their breakfast menu is relatively extensive (more than continental) it's also super busy with all of the hotel guests. This was not the case here. Although it could have been that there just weren't that many guests staying here because of the constuction. I didn't ever make it to the manager's reception, nor did I try the restaurant.
reviews.title: Great deal from Priceline

likes.liked: — The size of the room and cleanliness

reviews.text: Overall, it was a fine stay, but folks should be forewarned about the remolding going on for the next few months.
reviews.title: close to the airport but there are some probs

likes.liked: — proximity to the airport, gracious staff

reviews.text: This is a nice clean hotel next to John Wayne Airport and across from our favorite fine Italian restaurant Tuscany Mediterranee Grill
reviews.title: Great Clean hotel next to Tuscany Grill

likes.liked: — Next to our favorite restaurant Tuscany grill

reviews.text: we love statying here, near everything just off of 405 freeway.15 min to beach,rooms are clean staff is friendly ,they have free shuttle from the airport,quiet street,parking is not free,breakfast was okay but not great
reviews.title: Awesome Hotel!

reviews.text: over all it is a good value
reviews.title: Friendly staff; convenient shuttle

likes.liked: — Location for business; free local shuttle
likes.disliked: — Lighting; pillows; beer selection at manager's reception

reviews.text: We stayed two nights at this hotel last weekend.
reviews.title: Standard Business Hotel

likes.disliked: — charge for internet and location of room

reviews.text: I was very impressed with everything about this hotel.
reviews.title: I enjoyed my stay,but fitness room opens at 7am?!?

likes.liked: — The suites were large. Cook to order omelettes. happy hour.
likes.disliked: — the pillows were not too comfortable.

reviews.text: My family and myself stayed at the embassy suites for my daugters annual basketball tourament. After doing extensive research and checking other reviews for different hotels, I decieded to go with the embassy suites in irvine califorina. Although check in was'nt until 3:00pm we arrive in irvine at 11:00am we were unable to check in because it was to early, but the hotel did let us check in at 1:00pm. Upon checking in I was very impressed with the way the hotel looked from the outside and also the inside. The kids and I obtained the room key and proceeded to our room while my husband parked the car. The room was very spacousand clean. For the price that we paid I was very impressed, (110.00 night hotel.com non-refundable rate). The bed was very comforable, the room also had a microwave and a refridgator in it, the bathtud was very clean and so were the towels. The best part about the trip was the free buffet breakfast that was served (YES I SAID FREE!!!!) breakfast was served 7:30am- 9:30am, so we didnt have to wake up at the crack of dawn to eat breakfast. The chef fixed anything from french toast to any kind of omlet you wanted to ordered not to mention cold cereals, fruit, bagels, hash browns, ect. and for the adults we had happy hour from 5:30-7:30, FREE DRINKS, (YES I SAID FREE DRINKS!!!!!!!!!!) the only complaint that I have about the hotel was that it wasnt very kid friendly, the only thing the kids had to do was swim, and if your playing basketball there is no swimming until the touraments are over. The lady in the gift shop was a very sweet older lady, pleasant every time we went in. Over all we had a very pleasant stay, my family and myself would indeed stay there again.
reviews.title: Great room , Great price!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!
Embassy Suites compared to other hotels in area
reviews.text: I regularly travel into this area. I have stayed several times at the following hotels nearby : Embassy Suites Irvine, the Hyatt Irvine, Marriott Courtyard, Marriott Residence Inn, Westin South Coast Plaza, Hilton Orange County, Wyndham Orange County, Crowne Plaza, and Holiday Inn Costa Mesa.

I usually get these hotels on Priceline between 40-75 dollars a night. I like the Embassy Suites because it has free parking, free breakfast, and a free manager reception with alcoholic beverages. The lobby is very nice and spacious. It's a neat place to just sit and relax sometimes.
reviews.title: very nice hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: On the downside... internet costs money. The exercise room is on the small side. The bedroom is nice... but the living room in this suite looks more like a 2* affair. Instead of a tv stand, it's a big box sitting on the floor.. the kind u would find at a motel. The rooms could also use more lighting.
reviews.title: FIne for our needs

reviews.text: But for the price, I usually prefer this one over similar quality/price hotels in the area such as the Crowne Plaza and the Wyndham. The Crowne has free Internet and nicely decorated rooms, but the rooms are tiny (had to move the desk chair to walk pass the bed to the window or recliner) Parking is also like $12 or so per night.
reviews.title: DO NOT STAY THERE!!

reviews.text: Needed a place to stay for late flight into SNA, leaving early next morning. Priceline accepted $50 bid ($63 with taxes). Phoned prior to stay to confirm airport shuttle hours and request king room. Upon phoning for shuttle from airport was told it wasn't running do to "unforseen circumstances" despite being 30 minutes prior to end of hours. Asked for taxi reimbursement, but never received. King room was actually barely a full bed in a small corner room. Very obvious that Priceline booking = second-class citizen in hotel's view.
reviews.title: Didn't live up to even low expectations

reviews.text: Booked for a weekend getaway for my kids. Pool VERY small, weekends are times when families of teams competing in the area stay at the hotel, so extremely noisy. Room itself was quiet, but once you open the door all you hear is kids. Kids are running around all over the hotel screaming. Going up and down in the elevator and pushing all the buttons. Not the hotels fault, it's the parents of the children who aren't paying attention to what their kids are doing. Manager's reception a pleasant surprise. I thought there would be soda, but alcoholic drinks are included and free for 2 hours. Breakfast had a huge selection, but the items not cooked to order were cold on the buffet table. Cold sausage & cold bacon. Line was surprisingly short for a cook to order item. I thought I'd be waiting a long time on a Sunday morning.
reviews.title: Fair price at $119 a night

likes.disliked: — Extremely small pool and noise level

reviews.text: I booked this hotel for a one night family get away to the beach and Boy Scout O Rama.... I did my research on biddingfortravel.com and bid $45 for a 2.5 star in Irvine- I was so happy I got this hotel I can't even tell you. Honestly, they lost money on us- we checked in about 5pm on Saturday, easy as can be, you do have to pay for parking garage, but its close and convenient. At 5:30pm the managers reception with all you can drink (any kind!) for all the family and snacks- that night was nachos & chips with salsa and peanuts. For the four of us, that alone was worth $45 had we been at a restaurant, then we went to the pool and spa, it was nice enough, on the small side, because there was lots of loud kids & tipsy parents there.... the kids were throwing balls hard at each other, not the best. Anyway- the exercise room looked nice, updated equipment, if small. Our room was, yes 80s-ish, but big enough, with seperate bedroom, hurray, and fold out couch, plus room for the pack and play- 2 tvs. THere was a basketball team and a christian group staying there as well, so the place was packed. We were on the 9th floor and the kids loved the glass elevators. AND now for the great part- was the breakfast in the morning! Cooked to order- omlettes, waffles, pancakes, eggs, hashbrowns, toast, bagels, donuts, fruit, juice, coffee, yogurt- extensive. Awesome! And check out wasn't till 1pm. No one wanted to go down to the line, so i went back and forth to the room 5 times bringing up food for everyone before the lines got long- what a bargain- happy mom & happy dad + happy kids. Side note is that the in house restaurant used to be called the Main Street Grille is now the Ha Penny- they have a 2-4-1 coupon in the entertainment books- it says Main Street Grille, but they still accept the coupon- don't waste your money on the entrees- stick to the sandwiches- and they do serve kids dishes like grilled cheese, plus you can bring over your free drinks from the happy hour and there is a big screen TV there, that night was showing the simpsons, so kids were quiet as could be :) And this place is about 3 miles from the Irvine Wild Waters Water Park and about 5 miles from the beach.
reviews.title: Can't beat $45- free drinks/breakfast

reviews.text: Things I liked:
reviews.title: Great rooms & breakfast. Fitness/Pool area needs work.

reviews.text: We spent 2 nights at this hotel for a family (2 adults, 3 kids) getaway. The price was reasonable. 1 bedroom suites are great. I like the fact there are 2 TVs so kids don't fight over the remote. The sofa bed in the living room is a full size and quite comfortable. Has a fridge but no microwave. The walls seem well insulated as I didn't here much from the surrounding rooms even though each one had a full family as well. During our stay, there were some schools there for a drill team comp. So lots of kids roaming around but well behaved. The hotel allowed the kids to decorate the doors of there rooms to reflect their teams, which I thought was kinda fun and cool to see the different displays. The complimentary breakfast was fantastic. Buffet style but also had omelete, pancake, french toast station (does get a bit crowded at times). Staff, especially, front desk is very helpful and fast. Don't expect a lot of smiles from the maids or breakfast staff, however, they work very quickley.
reviews.title: Nice hotel

description: Stay at this premiere all-suite hotel in Southern California, Embassy Suites Irvine-Orange County Airport, offering a comfortable and stylish base just one mile from John Wayne/Orange County Airport. With Disneyland(R) Resort, University of California-Irvine and the Anaheim Convention Center nearby, there's plenty to explore. There are many things to do in Irvine - catch a game at Angel Stadium of Anaheim or the Honda Center, home to the Anaheim Ducks, or visit one of the nearby business destinations - United Health Group, Ernst & Young or Verizon Wireless. A complimentary shuttle service runs between the hotel and John Wayne/Orange County Airport. Relax in a spacious two-room suite with separate living and bedroom areas and outstanding amenities including two flat-screen HD TVs, dining/work space and WiFi (charge). Enjoy a swim in the indoor pool or relax with a soak in the whirlpool. Work out in the fitness center or work on business at the BusinessLink™ business center. Host an event in one of the meeting rooms with staff on-hand to coordinate and assist. Enjoy a tasty complimentary, cooked-to-order breakfast and a full bar with snacks at the Evening Reception*, in the atrium daily.
